projects.name: City Designer
projects.description: Site curating information for improving understanding of design challenges posed by a modern urban environment. The long-term ambition is to create a learning platform for engaging the public on how to design better cities for everyone, by everyone.

projects.name: Web Crash Course
projects.description: Intensive web development workshops for beginners. The idea is to get a person who has never seen code to publish their website on GitHub Pages in a single 4-hour sitting. The focus is on shipping rather than nuts and bolts of web development. The project is currently work in progress.

projects.name: Take Me To Denmark
projects.description: I initially used the domain to get accepted to a university in Denmark. Now the site serves as a source of information for people who are interested in studying in Denmark. Frontpage uses various APIs to fetch weather, news and concerts from Denmark.

projects.name: Information Design
projects.description: An experiment in writing an academic paper using Markdown and generating a finished document using various Web technologies. The paper itself looks at the history of design approaches and examines up-and-coming fields of human-information interaction and information design. It takes methods from those fields and applies them to analyzing information needs in the context of travel.
